newsitem.title: UK: Swedish timber vessels to use one pct bunker fuel.
newsitem.headline: Swedish timber vessels to use one pct bunker fuel.

text.p: Vessels in the Swedish timber trade have promised to use one percent sulphur bunker fuel in order to reduce pollution, the Swedish Forestry Industries Association said on Friday.

But one percent sulphur fuel is not yet widely available outside Rotterdam and Gothenburg, so the "strong recommendation" may not come into effect until early next year, said Staffan Thonfors, manager of transport policy at the Association.
"Shipowners have promised to use one percent fuel...
"But in some places it is hard to get this oil and of course when there is no demand it is not there. Perhaps when you ask for it, it will come up," he said in a telephone interview.

Thonfors said the Swedish forest products industry deploys 16 ships of between 10,000 and 15,000 dwt and that reducing the sulphur content will result in a reduction in sulphur emissions of 60 to 70 percent from these vessels.
There are currently no globally agreed curbs on bunker fuel sulphur content, which can be as high as five percent.
A bunker trader said one percent sulphur fuel was not widely obtainable although Scandinavian countries had introduced restrictions in their waters.
